8LrCc-mB_-Ws_4lBXWDOZw.text: This place sells the best coffee in Bishopsgate, it's a traditional Italian cafe, by which I mean scruffy and tired looking but not completely without a little charm.  They have a serving counter open to the street and many an office worker stops outside to pick up a very cheap roll containing a couple of stabilising rashers or sausages.  Have a bacon and egg sandwich here on white bread (this is the only thing you are allowed to use white bread for without being a chav).

C0CQknQlpTXuxJ7A1pzVrw.text: Little treasure this place.  Totally un-auspicious, it's tucked inside a very small, very slender interior.  There's a bar on one side, and plain red leather chairs around tables.  AND IT'S 24 HOURS!!  So, the number of times we've rolled up here, at quarter to 6 on a Sunday morning, you know what I'm talking about to clutch mugs of really hot tea whilst we plan our lie-ins...  it's a gem.They do food, lots of different sandwiches and paninis and that kind of fare.  Bottled beers.  Obv. teas and coffees, you know that kind of stuff.  And they got a very good range of breakfasts, again, 24-hour.  So, it's probably just another bar/cafe in this area during the day.  But if you're passing through Liverpool Street at some unGodly hour, and need warmth, caffeine or food, here's your place.

KAXzZ2yPOGM-K5ZWz6pynw.text: Can't really add anything extra than what saradoctors says, other than to agree with her. A 'traditional' greasey spoon, run by Italians. Nice and friendly and stonking bacon and egg butty.

112Z-iS1GbqVWYyzvhIMzA.text: Great place to stop for a bite to eat! Super close to the train station. They also have gluten free bread! Highly recommend.

xkHGpfruom9duiu5poYdvw.text: Once you understand the uniqueness of this place, you will be a fan. Reasons to love this place:1.  It is in a very interesting little spot that is easy to miss, if you aren't really looking. This makes it a "find" for a non-local visitor like me! Just across the street from Liverpool Station....still sort of hard to see - Clue: It is right by KFC.2.  It is open 24 hours.3.  Full and very diverse menu -  and everything is available at any time.4.  You get great food for a very reasonable price.5.  The service is good, and they turn the tables quickly ( at peak times there is a line....but it moves pretty quickly. )6.  Eyes Right, and you see the kitchen, and the people cooking for you - I like that!So far on our visits we have had: Eggs Benedict - awesome, cooked perfectly, very tasty.  Also, the traditional English Breakfast - complete with baked beans - interesting and good! And my son ordered the Bacon & Cheese sandwich - nice portion of lean bacon with melted cheddar cheese...I'm Jones'in for the Eggs Benny now, as I write this review...

CsjgKrqwqiJuT5BsUwbXrA.text: 24 hour goodness at an affordable price... shall I go on?This used to be one of my locals, and an absolute favourite despite not actually servicing alcohol... it was more like Polo Cafe at the time, and almost had an old school feel to it which I loved.Alas, a massive refurb has happened... mostly for the better, although I do miss the old vibe. Above said, for all intents and purposes this has become even more of a 24 hour treasure by most standards as they now serve alcohol and have far more seating than they used to. The service is friendly, but can be a bit sporadic depending on how busy they are and perhaps not as attentive as when you were all stuck in a small space, and the breakfast food is perfect for those late night fixes. I'm sure they serve other things, but to be honest I've always gone for late night/early morning breakfast which doesn't really disappoint given the hour and price... they do all the standards, including poached eggs, etc. I suppose it says something that I'm looking forward to a 24 hour tube service so I can find myself here on some weekends now that it's no longer my local... sure there are late night takeaways, McDonald's, and even the elusive Duck and Waffle, but my claim is staked squarely in the middle here. Four stars because it's not "epic", if it were a standard 9-10pm place it would be a different story, but make no mistake this is personally a 5 star place for me as it is.

z8V3HneBIEE28l4BbvU9Vg.text: Excellent breakfast spot.  I was in London for business and it was helpful to be able to get breakfast at 4 am to prepare for a long day ahead.  Excellent service.  The manager was at the counter and introduced herself.  Very nice staff and the food was excellent.  I had a traditionally English breakfast to go.

QhYYFRvX9mXXbryvLpl1fQ.text: I arrived in London the day before and due to jetlag, woke up around 4-5am. I started searching Yelp for breakfast places and found this little gem that was open 24 hours and only 2 miles away! I made my way there and found a cute little "grease spoon" that had a glorious english breakfast. The take out line was very busy but the eat in was not that bad at all. Great latte and will come back on my next business trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Glorious english breakfast

egqz3hsJtsce8fGn1vZTyw.text: Excellent Full English, good coffee, reasonable price.  Can't beat the location by Liverpool, and the hours.

dPSpflFMeD5UfCNWIHz3eg.text: Love it, the steak burger was sooo juicy and the cook replaced raw onion with a mushroom for me. The service is friendly and very personal/cozy.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom

eZhMhgI0H_xe_MfZHHiAQw.text: Decent after pub grub, seating available for when you can't stand, a bit pricey but who cares after a few, at least they have a good selection off savouries, sweets and hot/cold drinks. Being open 24 hours, a visit can be anytime you want

Fq84xsuObd8Ou9XryL2chg.text: These guys are perfect for breakfast when this side of zone one. Service is fast and very friendly. They hurry you in, but not out; just as it needs to be for a weekday breakfast. Though it's small inside, there's more than enough seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Bubble and bacon. Eggs Benedict with bubble and squeak. Moist, tasty, yum.

s2WIrDRUrEqTIddXPizLQw.text: Service is good, food is good, and they are open 24 hours. Late night dining is pretty chaotic/busy, would avoid if possible right after bars close, other than that a great 24 hour breakfast/diner.

dpH14ffimRANqErVNorHzQ.text: We ordered a hot chocolate and a vegetarian breakfast that had these really nice sausage shape things with vegetables and other things in them, it was really tasty.the hot chocolate was great as well and it seemed kind of cheap too maybe. Have you ever been here, literally open 24 hours when we went in we ended up sharing a table with some other people.One of these was a man with his girlfriend who might not be his girlfriend much longer, because as we were about to leave he started saying things like 'You only tell me you want to break up in the middle of (swear word) Liverpool Street at 3 in the morning' and other things like that. The woman didn't say much, I think she might be a bit scared of him but I don't know. she had a black eye.  When they first sat down the man said 'is she sleeping' (referring to my friend) and 'why is she so tired?'.He stopped talking for a bit then looked at the table and said 'did someone just eat breakfast?' and pointed at our plate. He said some other things.Another man came in and asked if he could sit opposite me.He started talking to man no 1. I got a newspaper from a shelf and looked at it. I started doing a crossword because I thought it might dissuade them from engaging me in conversation but I could feel man no 2 staring at me as I did the crossword. Man no 2 had bought two different meals and mixed them together.Man no 1 said to the man that was sitting opposite me: "Hey man I'm waiting for some friends, do you mind if I have a bit of that". he pointed at man no 2's food. Man no 2 looked at him like, are you serious and said "nah man I can't do that, I can't do that" and looked at his food. Man no 1 looked away and started talking to his girlfriend. Man no 2 said "I can't do that" again quietly. Feel like Man no 1 was testing to see if he could get some food for free but it didn't work.I could feel Man no 2 staring at me or my lap where I was doing the crossword. I thought, 'crosswords bring people together' and felt dumb or like an advert. He did this for a long time then he said 'Damn, how'd you get so fine' and 'You just grew up like that, right' (he was definitely drunk)Man no 1 saw me doing a crossword and said, 'If you want to know someone that can do those, its her' and pointed at his girlfriend. He said 'I mean it, she's the one you want, so if you get stuck, just ask her, she can do them'. No one said anything for a while, Man no 2 ate his food. Man no 1 seemed to be ignoring Man no 2. Man no 2 finished his food and said things about the crossword I couldn't really hear. he repeated himself a lot and I heard "Don't get stuck on that one crossword trust me" or something like that.  Man no 2 said 'OK I'll leave you alone if that's what you want me to do' waited for a bit, said "No?" then, "OK I'll leave". He shuffled out. Eavesdropping 101, after Man no 2 left, it seemed like Man no 1 was trying to start an argument with his girlfriend. It got to 4 am and we left.

Ob9S0E6BhEmfa7UUVnX-dQ.text: Very reasonably priced, good menu and casual enough for kids.  We liked the falafel wraps a lot.

CeidlMQu6eoWI4ynro0OjA.text: I experienced a HORRIFIC case of food poisoning here on Tuesday evening, after taking just two bites of my friend's plate of fish and chips.The very next day, I boarded a transatlantic flight to Philadelphia and suffered 12 miserable hours of nausea and vomiting, and continued to feel awful for 48 hours after I arrived at my destination. My friend, who consumed the entire toxic dish, was even worse off, vomiting multiple times over the course of a single Eurostar trip to Paris. She still has not fully recovered.This was the worst meal I have ever experienced in London. I am shocked that a well-known establishment like this one could have such low standards of quality control. I'm also embarrassed that I brought my unfortunate friend here for a meal, which poisoned her.Polo Bar should be ashamed of themselves for serving a fish so bad that a mere two bites could poison a customer so thoroughly as to completely incapacitate them for three days. Local residents and tourists beware!

vzC_LXaL1rXrNLhzF7kHyA.text: Something about this felt right and peculiarly encapsulating. There was all of the English tension between cultural angst and celebration bubbling oily through the experience. I am not qualified to speak on that, obviously, but I FELT it, I really did. Or something else, perhaps. Read on, help me out:Old and new? The young immigrant night-shift servers chatting loosely, labouring in the harsh-lit stuffy flimsy soulless classic forgettable-period interior, oppressed by weird dull early-20C soggy big-band vaguely patriotic standards. It's the owner, music-wise. That's what they tell me. He's got a notion of something that doesn't exist, it seems, and so insists on the period tunes. The result is not good. Stark yellowlit nighttime post-alcohol oasis manned by 20-something continentals with [insert corny old English composer's name here for perfect sentence] lilting out of the speakers. I love it.Good and bad? The familiar enshrined English breakfast, teetering on the edges of delicious and despicable, the intensely chemical-salted bacon stroking a craving with almost gagging intensity, the egg pleasant enough, oil-greased but thankfully not oil-drowned, the beans a touch dilute but not tragic, inducing palatal acceptance as a starchy counterpoint, the sausage of strange loafy texture beyond nomenclature but thoroughly, shockingly, satisfying to both mouth and stomach. It's hearty and filling and completely indecipherable by the gastric apparati: some straddling of immiscible good and bad, there is no middle ground. I can hear in my head (it's 2:30am, post-alcohol, OK?) the spectres of drunkards and tourists and bearded old men through the ages offering every sort of pronouncement on this meal. It's not what it could be. But is it what it, like, should be? Uh.  I don't know. I feel alternately queasy and sated. An insomniac's angular fluorescent haven in a sleeping city, is this place real? Have I eaten a physical meal or just ingested an uneasy part of some collective dream-conscious? I half expect to shuffle out onto cold Bishopsgate and glance back at a shuttered shopfront. Hm. Well, I don't look back but DO retreat into extracorporeal over-ear Beach House from an upper-front-left night bus perch. Let the stomach make its pronouncement in the morning.

8rdOyMN6HiujFpXe2Z6Qgg.text: Well, sometimes it's ok, and sometimes it's really bad. Last time I was here, it was an ok place to grab a snack before I took the bus to Stansted. This time, I had a take away. Not recommended. My fish and chips were soggy and wet within 15 minutes and the fish was full of bones. There's a KFC, a Wasabi and a Pret a Manger close by that are a better choice. Go there instead.

uHdWvxmr1_xpmRe_nSz5Ew.text: If I could leave zero stars I would but Yelp doesn't allow that. The staff was rude and unhelpful from the moment they picked up the phone. I should have known better at this point not to go into the restaurant. I called to place an order for pick up and the woman working hung up on me the first time. I called back and was able to place my order after I was transferred to someone else because the woman didn't want to take my order (I know this because I heard her in the background refusing to take it.) when I finished placing my order I was told that it would be ready in 10 minutes. I had a train to catch so I needed it to be ready when I arrived. I got to the general area but couldn't find the restaurant so I called again and was yelled at instead of just explaining to me where the restaurant was. Once I found the restaurant I went inside only to find out that the cook had no idea that there was a pick up order placed and the food hadn't even been started. At this point I was a bit upset and really didn't have any more time to waste. The lady at the register said she would start the food now but wouldn't start it until I paid even though she wouldn't tell me when it was going to be done and I told her that I was in a rush. All in all, I would never go to or advise anyone to go to this establishment due to the aggravation and hostility I received.

qyAY9Eiur-ePyIXYdQCbuw.text: Main reason to go: it's open 24hso... the sight of Polo bar in front of Liverpool st station can be seen as the Saviour when 1- most food snacks are closed in the station 2 - and there's too much queue at Burger KingFood we had was quite bad, oily: spaghetti bolognaise and bangers & mash (each £5) but i think the fat has saved us that nightTheir lemonade is good and refreshing thoughand nice staff

Cav6jVKJE0pdOAZ8vLWU9w.text: I've been here several times for breakfast and it's really good food for the price.  I have had the traditional breakfast, cheese omelet with chips, and the bubble and bacon.  The cheese omelet and chips was perfectly cooked and the chips had the perfect crunch.  The bubble and bacon is my favorite though.  It's served like eggs benedict with the bubble and squeak in patties at the bottom, a pile of bacon, perfectly poached eggs, and a mustardy hollandaise.  I always order a skinny cappuccino, which has a nice flavor but is always lukewarm.  I would send it back but they are always so busy and it doesn't bother me too much.  If  you have a choice I would suggest sitting downstairs, it's a bit more cramped but you get better service because they come to all the tables at once.  They have such a yummy looking selection of pastries upstairs that I might have to try one next time I come in.

nEzBA91PL_Pzj0Au81B-Tw.text: The 24 hour Polo Bar experience - insomniacs, night shift workers, bobbies on the beat, mascara-smeared after-club party goers. They've all fallen into the Polo Bar at some point over the night. With tacky red vinyl seats, fake melamine tables and bright lighting, it's not going to win any style awards.The food is pretty mediocre (can sometimes be quite awful too) - toasted sandwiches, burgers, all day breakfasts - Alan Yau can rest easy.The staff are generally friendly, which I know can be a little bit of a stretch at 4am in the morning. What I enjoy most is the chance to people watch. It's one of those places that is perfect for sitting and writing a novel about human behaviour. But only at night - during the day it's just a tired cafe.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom

l_TvZ-lKamzLMoWGVzYRaQ.text: Great place for late night breakfast

i_Y3xE94xISc0IE7hKNvBA.text: Went here at 4 am last night very livley astmospere not for the faint hearted dimly lit resaurent with a very good selection of food wich was served very quickly  even though they were very busy food is very good and worth suffering the loud noise of the place the 1 staff member i saw was very friendly and helpful i would recomend this place to anybody its defently sumthing different to try for a unusual midnight feast!

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Hot choclate the best iv ever tasted

3NKgDb2BWP5XYJbiy7vY8Q.text: We came here for a traditional English breakfast. OH my gosh it was HUGE and the pricing here is pretty cheap. The food came quickly and service was friendly. We really enjoyed our meal here. The only tough part is that I think the restaurant is somewhat "narrow" meaning its a tight space spread over three floors. We were brought up three flights in order to get to our table. Not a problem is you are mobile but if you had any sort of mobility issues, this would be a difficult place to navigate. The bathrooms were very antique-y and had pull string flushers (so funny). The only thing that made me uncomfortable was that there were blinds to cover large windows to the bathrooms/toilets. I could kind of look out and see the communal sinks outside...this made me somewhat paranoid that others could see in. But it certainly was not the end of the world. Considering this is a 24 hour restaurant (reminds me of what a New Jersey diner might be like in London) I think this was a great little spot to have a really hearty English breakfast.

FcBmSQseelCOzeiUhuF6rA.text: Perfect late night food in Shoreditch. Small but busy place with some great food. Breakfast for dinner is the way to go!

ElUa2jDrj-5JJQRpHokB9Q.text: A 24hr cafe! What's not to love! It's in such a convenient location, right opposite Liverpool Street Station. That means you can get eggs florentine at 4am Sunday morning after partying in Shoreditch, or how about a burger? This place is always busy so you might have to wait for a table or just get a takeaway and eat it on the night bus home. Look out for the guy who works there who looks like a really really young Woody Allen!

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Florentine.

jdgH1VJM2GakEXU2o_4pZA.text: Fresh orange juice, a really good bacon sandwich, and a nice coffee.then a Portugese Natathe breakfast of ChampionsStaff are great and the place is spotless

u2js7GwpAH8DXUUkVw0Ckw.text: Amazing food and easy to find, nice place and enough meal, get full when you ate it, but the Oreo milkshake is too sweet like a dessert not drinks, except that everything is nice

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Nice place and delicious food!!!!

hpbChTXcuuCDhBcUskyCLw.text: Ordered the polo special breakfast (didn't need the blood pudding).  Pot of twinnings everyday.  Quick service.  Prefer to sit downstairs, less stuffy.  Sausage wasn't as tasty but the bacon was awesome. Bread was slaughtered in butter.  Writing the review makes me hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Polo special
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Twinnings everyday
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Unique seating

QQMJWw61Jd5jdGpJXL-s5Q.text: First meal first day in London! :) My bus arrived extremely early at 4:30 am and I had told my friend I would arrive at her place at 8:30 am so had some time to kill. This 24 hour diner was the perfect place to sit. Limited seating on main floor but it appears there is seating upstairs perhaps as well. They have a heat lamp in the back which is great since the front door stays open. Had a flat white coffee and the vegetarian breakfast. Very hearty. I needed to charge my phone and there are many sockets. Ordered a black coffee as I waited. Sat for nearly two hours total eating and having coffee. Bill was brought out upon request and I never felt rushed or pressured to leave.

dsuglNqb4iY3SgyMjZgx0Q.text: Fantastic little place, right by the Station and food is simply fantastic. So good that Eggs Benedict for lunch makes perfect sense!Great interior and the staff are attentive but not intrusive. The Iced coffee is like milkshake and a meal in itself!!

2W8vgJX-MlJ1JhxIu5kVqw.text: This place is certainly a gem..and as it's 24 hour, we rocked up for a midnight date! Why not!?You could nearly miss it completely, with its tiny shop front on imposing Bishopsgate (it's right opposite Liverpool street station).  However, the inside is somewhat of a tardis and has 3 floors of super-cool subway tiles and old-school diner decor.The food is delicious - I opted for a philly cheese steak sandwich and my partner for eggs benedict. Both were delicious, and great value for money!  The service was mega friendly and relaxed, so they're happy to let you do your thing, without being hassled or feeling the need to top up your drinks ever half an hour. On the downside, however, I paid £3/4 for a freshly squeezed apple, lime and spinach, which came in a tiny glass, smaller than a half-pint (in my pics). I don't think that was very good value.So, you ask, why have they lost one star...?It's the atmosphere. Given the positioning on a busy street, this place should be heaving all of the time, but it was Saturday night, and we were one of two tables in (I didn't check upstairs, however). It could be the fact that they insist on playing dance music at a high volume at night (I'm here to hang out, not dance! I don't want to have to shout), therefore you can only have a conversation at one or two of the tables on the ground floor. Who knows? It's not exactly a hipster haven, though.All in all, i was pleasantly surprised and I would certainly go again! Perhaps in the day, this time, to see if they've turned down the music...

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Yummy midnight snack!
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom

gnLvk-TwE11KKLwRjEdiGQ.text: A rather rowdy crowd of 8 Scottish people stumbled upon this 24 hour bar late last night after a night out, hungry and in need of beer. We sat in the upstairs section of the bar and it was excellent. The menu is American Diner style as is the decor, but not in a naff over the top way. The menu has a range of burgers, hot sandwiches like philly cheese steak (yum) , omelettes, breakfast food and loads of different types of fries with toppings like bacon and cheese.I had the fish finger sandwich, great value at 5.50 and stacked high with hot fish and salad. The sweet potato fries were brilliant, so much so we ordered more. I tasted some of my pals food and it was all pretty good. There was a good selection of drinks including local craft beers and the one waiter upstairs could have not have been nicer. I was not expecting it to be so good and the food to be so fresh and tasty. Don't think you could find a better late night spot so reasonably priced with great staff. A winner and would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Omelette
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Philly cheese steak
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Fish finger sandwich

vXZB3u7VGWPpt2aKDmJqBw.text: Polo 24h Bar has finished some major renovations, adding a new upstairs area and switching to a different brioche bun for their burgers. The bun is more sturdy and crispy so everything held together and nothing fell out. The steak burger still comes medium rare and is still delicious. Chips haven't changed either. Really glad to see the new additions have just made this place better and the things there were good before have remained unchanged.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Steak burger + chips
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Crispy coated chicken burger + chips
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Energy juice - carrot, apple, orange, ginger & lime

MNlCE1NnSmXat4dv-SwORg.text: I stumbled on this place this past summer, on the last day of my London vacation a few hours before I was to fly home. It is right across from Liverpool Street Station so it is in a very convenient location. The staff were all friendly, and the place was very busy but I didn't have to wait more than 5 minutes for a seat. I ordered the Royale Pancakes after seeing them on someone else's table and all I have to say is that I had those were most amazing pancakes I have every tasted in my life. The food was DELICIOUS and beautifully presented. I fully intend to return to this place multiple times the next time I'm in London so I can try more of their menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Royale Pancakes

eyB04QpZE68i5xdDJdTUmA.text: We stayed at a nearby hotel when in London and the Polo Bar was spectacular to have right there. Not only were they open 24 hours, which helps with the jet lag, it also has a great interior and great food!! We ate there at least three or four times during our trip. Would definitely recommend to anyone in the area to stop in.

Di5mMgvse68xTE2W_Q7OLA.text: 24 hours, really cool place... Got like a cool hip vibe.. Local beers (Lagers and ciders)... Breakfast served all day long... Nice quite evening place to grab a beer and eat breakfast relaxed. The prices are okay, most of the things are under £10.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. The bar upstairs

JlrsCSUs81WwARzoAoAZUg.text: Late one evening after leaving Ten Bells on Commercial Street, my friends and I stumbled in here desperately seeking sustenance.  Despite having walked by here a hundred + times I'd never really noticed it before.This is the 24 hour diner I've been looking for!! From my perspective it's a British version of a classic American diner.  Great menu, ranging from breakfast 24/7 -- eggs, bacon, the usual....to burgers and hot salt beef....and fantastically including beer, wine and champagne to guzzle down with it. Food quality was excellent and provided in nice sized portions. Staff are friendly, service very good.  Prices are reasonable considering the area -- an omelette with 2 fillings, salad & chips for £7.50 is a good deal around here. I'm looking forward to my next late night visit.

a9gZ6UmwbSWXJZwn1GmN8A.text: Okay so the extraordinary Agi, a manager here, just allowed me to have a custom order of... check this out... a *salt beef omelette*! It was AMAZING - especially for 1am.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. SALT BEEF OMELETTE. YES.

856_3sXVT80tqkjNCZKEXA.text: For what it should be, it's decent. Don't expect high end gastronomy, but it's kinda cool to hang out somewhere else than in a club when the pubs are closing, you're not dressing up to impress and you're hungry. The service is also impressively fast and efficient given the amount of people!

iotL7AQcXJP0F9seUMoAVw.text: This is my first time in London and was determined to try a full English breakfast. I found Polo 24 on Yelp and made my way via the underground. It's location is prime for any tourist who is relying on the trains to get here. Once I arrived, I was greeted by a friendly waitress who attended to us right away. We knew what we wanted and have to say, wasn't disappointed. I added in a mixed berry juice to go along with the meal and that was delicious as well. I'll have to try and come back here before I leave to try out more from the menu.

G5AuBbT3DftIOoIYDkPTOg.text: We were visiting London looking for a nice place to have an early or late bite to eat. I also wanted to be able to afford it. The Polo Bar is that place. Variety with quality and quantity all at an affordable price. Throw in a friendly staff, delicious food and drink 24 hours a day and... well, we were there daily with a smile.Steak, burgers, eggs, pancakes, bacon, coffee, dessert. It's all good. :)

k6yjDq4jBPUyBwkJsXRANw.text: We were pretty hungry but couldn't finish our food because it was terrible! My friend's steak was like a tasteless chewing gum and my ribs were overcooked and the sauce was nauseous.Staff were rude too. We felt like we're not welcomed at all.

oaOdwr2dkBbeao17XnG0IA.text: One of the better breakfast experiences in all my time in the U.K.   Good omelets and  Eggs Benedict, the boys were very happy to have found this little place.  The bear on the wall made it even more unique.  Most people would pass it by based on appearance and location.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom

F_DiLEFMdOqpF7zid5rDuw.text: Busy little 24 hour cafe right opposite Liverpool station. Two floors of seating with a great menu selection of 'fast food' options including all day breakfasts, brunch, lunch, dinner, burgers and desserts. Literally no matter what time of day you could eat whatever food option you choose. They also have 'award winning pancakes'.Sadly I was only here for a coffee meeting today and in honesty the coffee wasn't that great but what I will say is I loved the overall vibe here and the staff - they were friendly, chipper and laughing and joking around which was a nice escape from the busy streets of the City of London.I'm definitely going to head back here for a late night meal. Any business that's 24 hours is fine by me and from the general Yelp hype it's definitely worth the visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom

tnzA3-2eZA-uQkQAMA4EWQ.text: This restaurant is close to Liverpool Station and was perfect for a quick breakfast. I had the poached eggs on toast.  They perfectly cooked.  The food was quite tasty and the service was prompt.  I'll be going back!

lqPJL0iPnpfL8qNL-36TXQ.text: Finding an all day brunch spot is always a gem. And not to mention, this restaurant is open 24 hours! At night, the restaurant turns into a bar.I came here with a friend on a weekday afternoon and were seated within 10 minutes. The floor space is small but the restaurant has three floors. They seemed pretty booked out for lunch, luckily my friend and I were able to grab one of the last few tables on the third floor. We ordered from the all day brunch menu. I got the American breakfast seeing it was July 4th and I'm from New York, and my friend got the Lox bagel with scrambled eggs. It was pretty interesting to see an American twist to the traditional English Breakfast. In terms of flavors, both the American breakfast and lox bagel were alright. The scrambled eggs were smooth but could be more runny. The American breakfast was decent and came in a pretty big portion but the hash brown could be more flavorful and the pancakes could be fluffier (yes, the American breakfast comes with pancakes, and bacon too). Overall, ingredients were fresh but flavors could be refined but I'm not complaining because it wasn't expensive. The best part about the restaurant is probably the decor, it gave the restaurant a fun and energetic vibe. The staff however weren't too friendly (but we did come at peak hours. I probably wouldn't come back but I'll definitely think of this place when I'm out in the wee hours.

2Oa3fv-yqrxQhoqqwObHkg.text: This place was a late night find that serves food 24 hours. The service was straight forward and without issue. The menu is complete and has a good deal of variety. The space itself is a tall vertical,narrow building so the tables are small and put into narrow spaces. It is fine for a late night dinner if you get caught in that position.

Y2z_w1WwCyttLNelWZl7NQ.text: After seeing the long queue at The Breakfast Club, we decided to find and alternative through the Yelp app. and wa really pl;eased that it directed us to the Polo 24 Hour Bar.A really nice little place set over 3 floors, all of which a quite narrow, so you have to be careful that you don't knock fellow diners as you manoeuvre your way to your table.As it was late morning, I wend for the Polo Breakfast, which at £6.99, I felt was a good deal. It was a standard English breakfast offering, and was really not greasy at all. It wqas washed down with two cups of English breakfast tea. My othere diners when for an Omlette and a Bacon sandwich. We were all plaesed with our choices.We p[aid £10 each, including a healthy sized tip. Highly recommend this place, and I understand it is open 24 hours (hence the name maybe!).

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom

7KnOOhDo_DqCDgI3E_W3sA.text: Got their milkshake, it wasn't thick at all. Seemed like I was drinking a chocolate milk. Perhaps there was a disruption in quality. Furthermore, they didn't have Mac n cheese available which is their main draw to their business. Bad day.

jHBw5qoXLUbDWB5qOcev_w.text: I have been a few times and definitely rate the full English breakfast.Please note however, that these have been consumed between the hours of 2/3am after more than a few jars. Seriously though they must be good - I even ate the sausage. And I'm a self confessed sausage snob.The service leaves a tad to be desired. The Oreo milkshake is good.

v0oykpXUWXhMILZqIBIs1w.text: Love this place.  24 / 7. Great breakfast and brunch all day and all night.  Hey have wifi and power plugs on the third floor.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Ground floor.  FYI most of the time there is no internet on the ground floor.
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Tea time with custard
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast

yaDQ-7wpOAk1LfnWG2sMPA.text: Usually I rate a restaurant for its food and if I was, I'll give this place three stars because with the prices they're charging you can probably go to a greasy spoon and get something similar for a lot cheaper and probably includes a drink. But the reason why I'm giving Polo 24 bar a four is because there's actually a place in London that opens 24 hours a day, located conveniently and not charging the world like Duck and Waffle lets just say. Plus the place looks pretty cool, very odd mid century British cafe decor with weird taxidermies on the wall. Let's just say it would be very hard not to fit in as you will get the business people, the group of friends and the tired builders.Service is a hit and miss. Depends on who serves you, what day you rock up and of course, what time too. I usually don't care what service I get as I sympathise with anyone working through the night and maybe doing the occasional shift work. Half the time they don't seem to care about us either and ignore the fact we have entered and want a seat. Ha! Win win situation.Food is pretty standard. Nothing that particular wows anyone and can be a mix bag at time. Depending on what you get it usually comprises of lots of different things and there's usually two or three things that are right and one or two things that are wrong. So we turned up at 22:00 after exhausting ourselves over some petty argument and every restaurant kitchen was closing. Only this place springs in mind and cures our hunger.We were seated upstairs which had the lights dimmed for relaxation and ordered the following:English teaStandard Tea from PG tips served better than you'll have it at home which makes it more special. Tea was in a classic ceramic teapot and milk was served in a cute glass bottle. Somewhat makes it taste better.Hot milkThey serve hot milk without giving you a weird look. Told you you'll fit in ;)American breakfast My American breakfast consisted of sausages, bacon, two fried eggs, a grilled tomato, sweet potatoes fries, mushrooms, pancakes and maple syrup. It was a pretty awesome combination. Don't think I can find anything quite like it anywhere else. Of course if you took each ingredient apart you'll find it's pretty simple but very filling. Pancakes were a bit dense but mixed in with everything else it would do. The best part was the lovely baked sweet potato fries, crisp and sweet and the perfect thing to dip into my runny egg yolks.Sticky toffee pudding  Just the standard good old sticky toffee pudding. Everything about it was right from being moist to sticky. Served with custard which I wished had more but for presentation it was served in a little bowl. After you got your food you're pretty much left alone to talk and relax as long as you want. The waiters were pretty much doing the same. It's a cool place with three floors so you don't usually need to reserve. It's comfortable too and great for emergency hunger spikes.  Oh and they do good burgers too!

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. American breakfast with sausage, bacon, two fried eggs, a grilled tomato, sweet potatoes fries, pancakes and maple syrup
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. English tea
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Hot milk

qICnIopC2IPTVyTZVoUB7w.text: I've been to Polo Bar a few times, since it's so convenient and is open 24hrs.The food is pretty good generally - great burgers, great chicken in a basket, decent shakes. My favourite dish though is the Welsh Rarebit. The seeded granary bread is a good choice and the tomato chutney works really well with the multi cheese topping. A really good light bite.On my last visit I opted for a poached egg on top and was disappointed to find the egg way overcooked.It's a good choice for a convenient meeting place near Liverpool St, although service can sometimes be slow. But generally not too bad.Oh and they do pretty good cakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Welsh rarebit with extra poached egg
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Cherry bakewell and chocolate brownie shakes

Xrny8nxxyzKw9d4fLKx4mA.text: This place is a pleasant surprise!  Good prices for the great food you get, charming fast customer service, and a fabulous atmosphere.  My friend was craving a steak pie, she ended up ordering the shepherds pie, and it was outstanding.  I'm not sure what else to say other than they are open late, and there is nothing to complain about!! Oh and they also have sriracha sauce, which is memorable for a person that likes spice like me!!

PtM4xsb1PEvKTkmpevX8wQ.text: Stopped here for dinner by chance.  Surprisingly good food and very large portions.  Fish and chips was huge and tasty and the steak and ale pie was also large enough to share. Good value.

xkMLaMLT_v_KCfrDpySXQw.text: Small little place with amazing coffee. Great alternative to the chain coffee shops surrounding Liverpool Street station. They have a few great looking food items as well, worth going back to in the near future.

aZ0zEGHAGtXXA1DyJq17VQ.text: Nice place in liverpool street! I believe they open 24/7 which is awesome! I had the English breakfast and it was awesome. Going to miss the food when I go back to the US.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Traditional english breakfast

ZRVm-iIeqf3g2PLvk0TuQA.text: After a night out boozing around the city, we were hungry. We had missed KFC and did not feel like making our way to our respective hoods to procure kebabs. We were in the Trading House and a city drinker overheard our despair. He told us about Polo Bar, a local late night food haunt over a couple of floors offering decent food into the early hours. Yes, our prayers had been answered. We headed on down to Liverpool Street and literally across the road from its entrance, there was Polo. You have options here, you can buy to go. Choose from massively filled hot dogs and much more, or you can get seated on one of the floors via a skinny staircase. We were put on the 2nd floor which already had other hungry revellers. We sat, perused the menu and were impressed with the offering although a little anxious about what would actually turn up to your table once ordered. Pranvera ordered ribs and damn they were big. This portion is not for the faint-hearted and even being hungry at this time of night, I think this is definitely a dish which could be shared. I went for steak which came with breaded mushrooms and onions on a pile of chips. Her ribs came with sweet potato chips and a gorgeous BBQ sauce. Considering this was quite late night, I was impressed with the standard of service and food. It was also not massively expensive to compensate for the inconvenient hours these poor folk have to work. I liked Polo and if I am ever in the area again in need of a twilight food injection, this will be my spot of choice.

AvpAnnC_X2-r3vCtPSrqEQ.text: I quite enjoyed their fry-up, only the black pudding was a bid drab and tasteless. Very good value nontheless, quick service, and very cozy.

SaXIzvOT6IbMRn0gQSPWHA.text: Can't really find a fault.Came here for breakfast and had the full English, doesn't include tea though.Right opposite Liverpool street stationIt's good for before going out, after going out, breakfast, brunch, dinner, elevenses, second breakfast, hangover cures!It's literally 24 hours so you can get good foodIf I had to pick a wish it would be that it was closer to where I live

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Full English Beans, black pudding, Cumberland sausages, egg, bacon, mushroom (not tinned) 9.70 thankyouverymuch
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Ever get the feeling you're breakfast?

plgjxAEyiUCntYSsyCI3JA.text: Went in for a very quick coffee stop before meeting a train at Liverpool Street. Was very impressed the the pasties on display and coffee met my Melbournian tastes :)

gUYx9RYUUikxgrleNvTOkg.text: Nice iced coffee and cappuccino. The all American all day breakfast can be shared by two.Excellent staff. Close to Liverpool station.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. The all American all day breakfast.
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Iced coffee.
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. The all American all day breakfast.

RgJehlNinOCn4cHirAJ1SQ.text: Late night eats? Check.Came by here on our last night in London around 11pm with a group of 6 people, and was seated right away. We all decided on some dishes from the menu, and one by one we were told the item we wanted was sold out, so we took another 10 minutes to decide on other items, and this time only half of the things we wanted were sold out, but then randomly were told the ribs we wanted to start off with were no longer sold out. We think it was just a miscommunication with the staff and the kitchen, but the food we got was all alright, but nothing to write home about. Solid place for late night eats, just dont come in with any high expectations as they may be sold out of your first and second choice.

JMbaWm4uyHIpBRyXh0SK4g.text: It was my last day in London and I had not yet experienced the full traditional English breakfast.In the early morning hours, I was able to find Polo Bar, which was conveniently located near the hotel I was staying.The bottom level is an Italian bakery and while I was tempted to get a cannoli, I was here for breakfast.Now if by some chance you, my reader, are unaware of the concept of the full English breakfast, let me explain.The full English breakfast is a breakfast plate consisting of eggs, bacon, sausage, fried tomato, bread, and mushrooms. Sounds like a typical breakfast right? Well, the stuff gets deeper. The last few items baked beans and black pudding, make this breakfast unique to the UK.Once that plate was set down on the table I went straight for those baked beans. They are sweet and pretty much what I get from a can. Not necessarily a bad thing, but nothing unique here. Very simple molasses flavor. The beans are soft and break apart easily. Now, bite into that bacon. This isn't typical bacon, but more like Canadian bacon or a slice of ham in terms of thickness. Lacks the crisp, slight char and gratuitous saltiness of the beloved American bacon. Rather, this bacon is mild, soft and chewy. I enjoyed pairing it with the beans as they compliment one another. Salty, sweet, chewy, fatty. It's a crowd-pleasing combination. The sausage is a breakfast sausage so don't expect a juicy interior or satisfying snap. But it has a simple flavor profile, slightly grilled, greasy, savory and a little spicy. Also is a decent length, girth, and density, unlike other breakfast sausages that are mostly grease and filler. Bread is very crisp and slightly blackened. Thorugh and deep buttering. Butter has a nice creamy and cultured taste. The mushrooms are sauteed and have a chewy texture. Tomato is partially cooked and has a nice balance between that raw acidic tang and roasted sweetness. Semi-melted texture with some juices pooling underneath. Sunnyside up egg has a slightly rubbery white, but the yolk is is the perfect texture. Slightly thick and runny. I enjoyed coating the sausage in that runny egg yolk. But the egg does seem to be a cheaper egg as the white has a slightly rubbery quality. Either that or it was cooked too quickly...or maybe it was a lower end egg not given the love it needed to reach full sunnyside up potential. I saved the best for last. Black pudding was the gem of the meal. Has a nice bready texture with a sage undertone. No, it doesn't taste like blood, but there is a distinctly savory quality here. Soft and moist with some solid bits of grain. I really enjoyed the complexity here. Furthermore, it doesn't need to be paired with anything to enhance flavor. The full English breakfast does a good job of covering the food groups. The focus seems to be on savory and salty. Only sweetness comes from the beans, which is still kinda savory. Each item by itself is simple, but together as a whole it is a satisfactory experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Full English Breakfast.
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom

8V00RfOf15hsyqmOZPsQkw.text: It was after midnight and we were starving, the originally plan was to head on over to Duck & Waffle since they are a 24 hour place, but we got dress coded (jeans with rips in them, bought that way) and told ripped jeans are not allowed so we were turned away, so I quickly looked up 24 hour places on the Yelp app and found Polo 24 hour bar which was close, so off we went.After checking out the menu I went with the eggs benedicts, my friends thought I was nuts, but it just sounded the perfect meal.I ordered the bacon benedicts, it was grilled bacon with poached eggs on a handmade muffin covered in hollandaise sauce, and I must say these were some great eggs bennys, definitely hit the spot. Friends enjoyed their meals as well. This was a great find for a late night eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom

kuDIwC3fFApHgpRMWyCngA.text: The American burger, cheesy chips and milkshake was good but it'd be nice if the waitress would get off her phone so I could get out of here and away from the horrible music they're playing.

IZtFUCX3zqiLwg8Jfq96yw.text: If you come here with low or moderate expectations you will not be disappointed. After sleeping the day away with jetlag I needed to eat the foods. There was nothing open in the middle of the night where I was staying so I followed shady Google maps walking directions here. When I got here it was completely packed on the first and second floors. I was lucky to get a table. Later I found out this is across the street from the Aldgate tube station, which is probably better than wandering abandoned streets in 30-degree weather. The service was fast and the food came quickly. The bf and I both ordered burgers and chips. The burgers were excellent, however, I would caution against ordering the chili burger. The UK definition of chili burger (a burger with sliced jalapeno) is apparently not what it is in the US (a burger with a ladle of chili on top).  There are definitely a lot of travellers getting oddly timed meals in here. They offer breakfast foods as well as full plates, so there's something for everyone here at odd hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. "chili" burger
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Menu

m5BmrsWuRlh3d0056nJi9Q.text: Had one of the best breakfast here in London at Polo 24 Hour Bar. I was searching for a breakfast open at 6:00am because we had to head over to our Stonehenge Tour at 8am. My friend ordered the American breakfast and I ordered the floretine eggs Benedict. I like that the egg muffin was nice and crispy and that the hollandaise sauce isn't too overwhelming. Best thing about this place is that it's open 24 hour! Yippppie. Their chocolate crossaints were also really delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Bar
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Menu

FzYkO6AxICVIkPKCC8ncfg.text: Context, I just landed on a red-eye from New York.Hunger level: ready to eat a cowWhile I didn't eat a cow at Polo 24 hour bar, I did get some pork. For a hungry, growing man, the breakfast here was delicious. The eggs were made to order, and the hash browns for crispy and fresh. The meat was succulent and juicy, and wasn't too hard or chewy. I enjoyed it so much that I ordered additional bacon and eggs!These guys know their breakfast, and I wouldn't hesitate in coming back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom

tlPlihdt2tUvUjZ9ILPmbg.text: I had been scoping this place out since we booked our flights to London! I had seen their page on Instagram and wanted to come here as soon as we landed! On my birthday, my husband took me here for lunch, it wasn't at all busy so I was happy we got a table right away, there are three levels and a lot of steps but it was definitely worth it. Our server was a really nice man, he let us take our time while we looked at the menu, we were being the biggest tourist taking photos of everything going on. The decor is so fun, the huge British Flag in the window and hopefully a fake stuffed bear. I ended up ordering sausage and mash while Bryan ordered the Polobar Steak Supreme Burger with a side of chilli cheese chips. We were so excited to see chilli on the menu, little did we know they were going to sliced chillis! I laughed so hard, a little misunderstanding but really delicious either way. The portion size is huge, there was so much mash I couldn't finish it all! The food was so good and Bryan said it was the best burger he had the whole trip. After our food, we ended our lunch with homeade scones and clotted cream along with tea and a glass of bubbles. We also had a slice of carrot cake as my birthday sweet. It was wonderful and they really used cream cheese frosting which I am a stickler for. We chatted for a bit with another server while ours went home, she too was really lovely. We had wanted to Scotland and told us the best ways to get to the train station that would take us to our airport! She was amazing, I wish I had gotten her name! Thanks so much for the hospitality Polo Bar, we cannot wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. The window!
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Tea, scone with clotted cream and jam.
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon tea with bubbles and carrot cake.

nAtc4xgeNoTJwattZzvRgg.text: The good: 1. Anything open past 12 midnight is like an oasis for an American as we're spoilt with 24 hour places across our land of freedom (to work oneself to death). 2. The burgers are awesome and the American style greasy spoon to go feel is sparky. 3. The variety is a big draw with everything from classic fry up to 'Chorizo and Guac Eggs Benedict on a sweet potato base'!!!!The bad:1. I found their Vegetarian breakfast underwhelming with the bubble and squeak being cold and the hash brown (just the one) being definitely de-frosted without any crispiness or golden glow. 2. Service can be a little slow even when it's not that busy and unfriendly. 3. Bloody mary was very bland. Not impressed. The ugly: Drunk people at 3am trying (often unsuccessfully) to order things and the staff trying to to refrain from clocking them.

oF2XRZOaJEwQw4zKEnSIQw.text: Spitalfield sucks but having this place around the corner was relief and sanctuary with good food.

LRfWw79s5jYcvKfCvUn5aQ.text: Found this place after being turned away at Duck and Waffle (ugh- terribly rude place) But I'm glad we ended up here! We got in and were seated right away, service was quick and friendly, and the portions were big and tasty. Our plan for our trip was to avoid any "American style" food, but the ribs at Polo were good enough to make it worthwhile to break the rule! Good food, good prices, good people! Check it out.

wUHxrkGhbP3HzU-jYp3yLA.text: Really not sure about the Polo Bar.The food portions are great, but it's very unhealthy stuff... more American themed than anything.I ordered a spicy bacon sandwich - which was nice - but SO MUCH bread, and quite reasonable at £5, my friend the American Pancakes for £10.50.The Pancakes were tiny and the fries were not fully cooked in the middle. Although she seemed to enjoy everything else.I love the idea it's a 24hour bar... will try and remember that if I need some food when out late... but otherwise I won't voluntarily return - because my biggest gripe was the staff and the restaurant itself was quite grotty.The staff really weren't friendly - they almost seemed annoyed we were there. Not the greatest reception or impression!

s1u0TNUhHRRsV0vd80GoZg.text: Must go too place to eat. So good! I literally never finish my plate of food. I'm a small girl usually eat half a plate or pick at my food then eat it later, but once I had that first bite I couldn't help but eat it all. I almost wanted seconds!  We had the English breakfast that came with beans,sausages, ham, toast and eggs. It's the perfect breakfast not to heavy not to light perfect way to start of your day. P.S. No breakfast will ever be good enough after eating this dish. Trust me! I know lol

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom

K7kKjCfu-CLnCTBBMKeKhg.text: I got the Vegetarian Breakfast, which had bubble and squeak (potatoes and other vegetables in a patty), eggs, roasted tomato and mushrooms, hashbrowns, baked beans, and toast. My dish was pretty good, but my friend was disappointed with her Smoked Salmon breakfast with scrambled eggs, guacamole, and bagel. Her dish was soaked in oil and made her feel sick afterwards. However, I'm still giving them 4 stars because I liked my dish, so it might be a hit or miss. Also, I love that they are open 24/7, because I was able to pick up food before work at 6:30 before any other stores opened up.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Vegetarian breakfast

rDGB6JRjvLRpGMSUztjpzQ.text: First off, this place is open 24 hours. That in-and-of itself is cause for celebration in a city that closes everything ridiculously early. And while I'm not the biggest fan of heavy American food- being that I'm an American- it's actually pretty good. The fare from the hot dogs to the breakfast platters, which are served all day, are all great. The pancakes come in many different varieties, the drinks are plentiful, and the seasonal specials are always worth a try. Just know that it is very much diner food, and if you're used to surviving on salads and quinoa, this might not be the place for you. Given that it's near a lot of cool hangouts like the Sushisamba right next door and pubs galore, it's the perfect place to grab a late-night bite with your friends after all the other kitchens have closed.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. British Breakfast
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Christmas Dinner Burger with all the trimmings.
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. American Breakfast

0sIuvR_flFi-iCPdG8jCIw.text: Absolutely the best full breakfast we've had in London. My husband had a full English breakfast with scrambled eggs tons of bacon, blood pudding, baked beans, scrambled eggs with bubble and squeak. I had bubble & squeak - kind like eggs Benedict but gorgeous poached eggs with stunning and tasty super orange yolks sitting on bubble & squeak (mashed potatoes with smashed peas...so good), delicious bacon and topped with an awesome Bearnaise sauce. Service was great. Coffee perfect. We even went back for afternoon tea and dessert. Too bad today was our last in London. It's right near Liverpool tube Station. Don't miss it

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom

_-zSTl-uh4UFIhhBO3GD9g.text: Had the American breakfast here and it was amazing! Brilliant staff, fantastic food, seating is a bit crammed, but they make the most of what they have. Thanks for making our visit so awesome, would definitely recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom

kM2B3fgsTk1125xYgIa5Xw.text: This place is cool. I dig the vibe. And the wall-mounted bear wearing a top hat. Like I said, the vibe. And it served me hot food at midnight on a Sunday.The food itself was just OK. OK was fine for midnight on the Sunday. The bacon with my pancakes was actually delicious, like most British bacon. The pancakes were overcooked and not hot, which was weird. They were like the pancakes I used to make when I was eight and couldn't figure out when to flip them. Maybe the Brits don't do pancakes the way Americans do. Maybe that's the way they are supposed to be.Thank goodness I could eat those pancakes with bites of delicious bacon.The green detox smoothie was also delicious; it's healthiness made me feel better about all the bacon.

photos.caption: Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. Bacon. And overcooked pancakes -- especially that guy in the middle. But, bacon.
Photo of Polo 24 Hour Bar - London, United Kingdom. He can't bear to see all these drunk youngsters eating so well late at night.

65G_DciGub9gsso4OfQR2g.text: One of the few 24 hour spot in London. It's pretty good and cheap! Actually, it's damn tasty. This was my second time eating here. I had the salt beef! It's seasoned well and ready in a hurry. If you're partying in Shoreditch/East London, come here after the club for some hearty drunk food. My only gripe is that they leave the front door open. So if you dine in and sit downstairs, you'll be freezing the whole time. Nonetheless, the food is worth it!
